parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (somewhat rare) (of clothing: I put on another); mid: I put on (myself). A prolonged form of enduo; to invest.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Latin origin; the 'purple' mussel, i.e. the red-blue color itself, and finally a garment dyed with it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To weave together, plait, twist, braid. A primary word; to twine or braid.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
Made of thorns. From akantha; thorny.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To place or put around, clothe; fig: I bestow, confer. From peri and tithemi; to place around; by implication, to present.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
